FacilityName: National Beef Packing Company, LLC, Liberal

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
NATIONAL BEEF PACKING CO., L.L.C.- LIBERAL, KANSAS



1. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



National Beef Packing Company, L.L.C. (National Beef) owns and operates a beef slaughter house and packing plant in Liberal, Kansas.  On site, National Beef has an ammonia refrigeration system which contains anhydrous ammonia, a regulated hazardous substance, for the refrigeration of meat at the facility.  The maximum intended inventory of anhydrous ammonia on site is above the threshold quantity listed in 40 Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) 68.130.



Because the quantity of anhydrous ammonia exceeds the threshold quantity, National Beef is required to implement a Risk Management Program (RMP) at the Liberal, Kansas plant which includes three (3) major elements: hazard assessment, prevention program, and emergency response program.  The submission of the RMP Plan presents the details of the RMP compliance measures conducted by National Beef.  In the first-time submission of the RMP information on June 23, 1999, National Beef inadvertently completed the RMP report as a program level 1 submittal.  In fact, National Beef had in place all components necessary for a program level 3 RMP.  The RMP report was resubmitted in January 2002 to correct the inadvertent error and to properly submit a program level 3 RMP report.



1.1 Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies



National Beef is committed to the protection of the safety, health, and environment in our routine operations and emergency responses.  Our prevention and emergency response practices are developed to protect the public as well as our own employees.  It is our policy to comply with applicable laws, and to support and work with local emergency response agencies.  To implement this policy, the following plans are maintained and implemented at the Liberal facility:



Emergency Response Plan

Process Safety Management (PSM) Program

Risk Management Program



These programs and procedures provide comprehensiv

e planning for accidental and emergency situations. 





1.2 Description of National Beef and the Regulated Substance Handled



The National Beef Packing Co., L.L.C. Liberal, Kansas plant located at 1501 East 8th Street is a beef slaughter house and packing facility.  Live cattle are received and slaughtered, and fresh meat is cut and packaged.  The ammonia refrigeration system provides the necessary refrigeration of the meat.  In addition, the ammonia refrigeration system is utilized to provide cooling for the plant itself.  There are approximately 230,000 pounds of anhydrous ammonia located within the closed-loop ammonia refrigeration system.



1.3 The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps



National Beef has specific process controls in-place to minimize the risks of spills.  National Beef is subject to OSHA's Process Safety Management Program (PSM).  National Beef has a preventative maintenance program in place to address maintenance of all vital parts of the ammonia refrigeration system.  All inspection and testing procedures are addressed within this program.  In addition, there are many safety controls installed within the system.  These include an interlock system, relief and check valves, manual and automatic shutoffs and alarms located within the ammonia refrigeration system.  



1.4 Five year Accident History



National Beef has documented two accidental releases during the past five years.



1.5 The Emergency Response Program



National Beef's emergency response policies summarize the actions to be taken in response to a chemical spill.  In the event of a spill, National Beef will react with the proper actions as listed in the Emergency Response Plan in association with the local emergency response agencies.  Local emergency respondees are familiar with the facility and the hazards of release.



1.6 Planned Changes to Improve Safety



National Beef makes safety a first priority in its every day ope

rations to ensure a safe working environment for all of its employees. National Beef is committed to continuously improving the facility's safety and working practices through employee involvement and development.



A Process Hazard Assessment (PHA) was recently performed at the National Beef facility.  A number of safeguards identified during that PHA are being implemented to improve the safety of the anhydrous ammonia process as well as reduce the chances and magnitude of any anhydrous ammonia spill.
